author: Special Correspondent
text:
A ten-metre-wide bridge constructed by the Chennai Corporation across Padi Kuppam Canal on Padikuppam Road will be inaugurated next week.

The bridge will link Mogappair with Poonamallee High Road.

However, the recent collapse of the Rail Nagar bridge across the Cooum during the floods has taken the sheen away from the project.

Residents said that without the restoration of the Rail Nagar bridge across the Cooum, the inauguration of the new bridge would not make any difference.

Motorists would have to take yet another circuitous route crossing Golden George Nagar to reaching Poonamallee High Road.

The 100-metre road bridge that collapsed in November provided connectivity to Poonamallee High Road.

Currently, most of the motorists use the stretch of Jawaharlal Nehru Salai to reach Koyambedu Wholesale Market and CMBT.

The 45.75-metre-long bridge has been constructed at a cost of Rs. 1.44 crore.

Residents of Anna Nagar West, Collector Nagar, Kamaraj Nagar said motorists would make optimum use of the bridge once the Padi Kuppam Road was widened. The Chennai Metropolitan Development Authority permits multi-storeyed buildings on Padi Kuppam Road which is more than 18 metres wide. The stretch has many bottlenecks, reducing the width beyond the standards set for multi-storeyed buildings.

Residents say the Rail Nagar bridge across the Cooum should also be restored at the earliest
title: Bridge over Padi Kuppam Canal to be opened soon
